ygData.subject: Re: 1 Handed Magic Weapons
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi again, As this Emameled Black Mace is new to me can you tell me if this is a quest item or if it is an item dropped by a certain beast?  I do not know
ygData.messageBody:
Hi again,

As this Emameled Black Mace is new to me can you tell me if this is a quest
item or if it is an item dropped by a certain beast? I do not know anyone
with it so I am a bit curious on how to aquire it.

Lady Bree Nightingale of Mercenaries of Doom
27th circle
Fennin Ro
-----Original Message-----
From: Ryan Robinson <bigsexxyryan@...>
To: EQ-Clerics@onelist.com <EQ-Clerics@onelist.com>
Date: Friday, June 04, 1999 3:51 AM
Subject: [EQ-Clerics] 1 Handed Magic Weapons


>From: Ryan Robinson <bigsexxyryan@...>
>
>First Off i like to say High to all fellow Clerics. Im a 29th Cleric on
Mith
>Marr server. SO far there are only 2 magical 1 handed weapons in the game
we
>can use besides all the normal ones and are spells. We all know about the
>screaming mace, but i would like to Add about the Enamaled Black Mace which
>i currently have, does 8 damage, 28 speed and magical. Now i can rip some
>ass with this weapon. Not to mention im doing 198 damage with my new Wrath
>spell which is a upgrade from Smite. Now i need to stress that you toss the
>2H weapons and start working on 1H. At high levels you are going to need
>shields for sure, the more magic resistance you have the safer you will be.
>Right now i have a mistmoor shield which gives +10 Ac +10 resistance to
>Magic, Disease & poison. Believe me anyone that has been to Mistmoor knows
>that you need all the magic Resistance you can get. Not to mention we get
>buff spells, so currently when im fighting i have 60 resistance and seeing
>you resist 3 Shock Of Force spells in a row makes you breath a little bit
>better :)
>
>If anyone has any questions about spells or anything give me a shout
>
>Enursin, High Cleric "Black Tower Guild"
>
>
>------------------------------------------------------------------------
>Give back to your community through "Grow to Give."
>http://www.onelist.com
>Deadline is June 19. See homepage for details.
>
